title.native: フルメタル・パニック！Invisible Victory

description:
Nine months have passed since teen soldier Sousuke Sagara first became Kaname Chidori's covert protector. In that time, Mithril has been remarkably successful at thwarting Amalgam's efforts, but this has only made Amalgam more determined. Leonard Testarossa's visits with Tessa and Kaname are just preludes to all-out attacks that begin with global communications disruptions. Kaname's status as a Whispered makes her one of Amalgam's main targets, which means that any semblance of a peaceful life at Jindai Municipal High School is now over for her.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Anti-Hero

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/162305754) | [Website](http://gatoh.com/)

Noted as the creator of the [Full Metal Panic!](https://anilist.co/manga/40892/) franchise.

Gatou first met [Kouichi Chigira](https://anilist.co/staff/106134/), the director of Full Metal Panic's first season, by accident when he bumped into him in Shinjuku when he was late for work. The two were surprised to later meet each other at [Gonzo](https://anilist.co/studio/3/)'s offices.

He has also worked as a scriptwriter on a handful of [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/)'s shows after their involvement in adapting Full Metal Panic, most notably working as the lead writer on [Hyouka](https://anilist.co/anime/12189/). He also supervised the studio's production of [Amagi Brilliant Park](https://anilist.co/anime/20602/), which was adapted from another light novel of his.

In 2019, Gatou posted controversial remarks to his Twitter about teenage environmental activist Greta Thunberg, but later removed the tweet in response to public backlash and apologized for writing it.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/162305754) | [Website](http://gatoh.com/)

Noted as the creator of the [Full Metal Panic!](https://anilist.co/manga/40892/) franchise.

Gatou first met [Kouichi Chigira](https://anilist.co/staff/106134/), the director of Full Metal Panic's first season, by accident when he bumped into him in Shinjuku when he was late for work. The two were surprised to later meet each other at [Gonzo](https://anilist.co/studio/3/)'s offices.

He has also worked as a scriptwriter on a handful of [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/)'s shows after their involvement in adapting Full Metal Panic, most notably working as the lead writer on [Hyouka](https://anilist.co/anime/12189/). He also supervised the studio's production of [Amagi Brilliant Park](https://anilist.co/anime/20602/), which was adapted from another light novel of his.

In 2019, Gatou posted controversial remarks to his Twitter about teenage environmental activist Greta Thunberg, but later removed the tweet in response to public backlash and apologized for writing it.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ToshiSahashi)

__Toshihiko Sahashi__ is a Japanese composer and arranger. He graduated from Tokyo National University of Fine Arts and Music in 1986. Sahashi has composed music for various anime series (including OVAs, films, and drama CDs), video games, films, dramas, and musicals.

The style of his composition is richly symphonic and classical (occasionally jazz). The use of sophisticated compositional techniques, as well as complicated harmony writing such as fugue can often be heard in his work, demonstrating his solid training in the western classical music. He also uses keyboard instruments to deliver more sentimental soundtracks to good effect.

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tomoki_kyoda/)

Influenced by Hiroyuki Nakano's commercials and music videos, he studied video art at the Musashino Art University, joining Gento Matsumoto's company Sal Brunei as a graphic designer. He soon changed his occupation to the animation industry, having aspired to be an animation director since his childhood. 

He initially joined [Group TAC](https://anilist.co/studio/86/Group-TAC) where he worked as episode director and storyboard artist under the guidance of [Mitsuru Hongou](https://anilist.co/staff/103366/Mitsuru-Hongou). His first major role was as mechanical/creature designer on [Chikyuu Bouei Kazoku](https://anilist.co/anime/1962/The-Daichis--Earths-Defense-Family/), working alongside [Shouji Kawamori](https://anilist.co/staff/97501/Shouji-Kawamori) and [Kazutaka Miyatake](https://anilist.co/staff/100987/Kazutaka-Miyatake), with whom he would collaborate profusely afterwards. 

He later moved to studio [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/bones) landing as assistant director for [Yutaka Izubuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/99075/Yutaka-Izubuchi)'s [RahXephon](https://anilist.co/anime/165/RahXephon/). The two became close collaborators, with Kyouda soon taking the leading role on the [RahXephon: Pluralitas Concentio](https://anilist.co/anime/758/RahXephon-The-Motion-Picture/) movie.

Soon after, he directed [Eureka Seven](https://anilist.co/anime/237/Eureka-Seven/), incorporating his love for music and different sub-cultures into mecha anime.
Founder and representative director of Otonarium.

[Website](https://www.heart-company.co.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Saito_S_HC)

Produces and directs music. Founder of Heart Company.
